# c4ptur3-th3-fl4g

Laurent Chauvin | October 31, 2022

## Resources

[1] https://gchq.github.io/

## Progress

### Task 1 : Translation & Shifting

L33t Speak
```
c4n y0u c4p7u23 7h3 f149?

CAN YOU CAPTURE THE FLAG?
```

Binary
```
01101100 01100101 01110100 01110011 00100000 01110100 01110010 01111001 00100000 01110011 01101111 01101101 01100101 00100000 01100010 01101001 01101110 01100001 01110010 01111001 00100000 01101111 01110101 01110100 00100001

lets try some binary out!
```

Base32
```
MJQXGZJTGIQGS4ZAON2XAZLSEBRW63LNN5XCA2LOEBBVIRRHOM======

base32 is super common in CTF's
```

Base64
```
RWFjaCBCYXNlNjQgZGlnaXQgcmVwcmVzZW50cyBleGFjdGx5IDYgYml0cyBvZiBkYXRhLg==

Each Base64 digit represents exactly 6 bits of data.
```

Hexadecimal
```
68 65 78 61 64 65 63 69 6d 61 6c 20 6f 72 20 62 61 73 65 31 36 3f

hexadecimal or base16?
```

Rot13
```
Ebgngr zr 13 cynprf!

Rotate me 13 places!
```

Rot47
```
*@F DA:? >6 C:89E C@F?5 323J C:89E C@F?5 Wcf E:>6DX

You spin me right round baby right round (47 times)
```

Morse
```
- . .-.. . -.-. --- -- -- ..- -. .. -.-. .- - .. --- -.

. -. -.-. --- -.. .. -. --.


TELECOMMUNICATION ENCODING
```

Decimal
```
85 110 112 97 99 107 32 116 104 105 115 32 66 67 68

Unpack this BCD
```

Base64 + Morse + Binary + Rot47 + Decimal
```


Let's make this a bit trickier...
```

### Task 2 : Spectrograms

Open wav file with sonic-visualizer:
```
sonic-visualizer secretaudio.wav
```

Right click -> Add Spectrogram.

Zoom in.

```
Super Secret Message
```

### Task 3 : Steganography

```
steghide --extract -sf stegosteg.jpg 
Enter passphrase: <Enter>
wrote extracted data to "steganopayload2248.txt".
```
```
cat steganopayload2248.txt                    

SpaghettiSteg   
```

### Task 4 : Security through obscurity

```
binwalk -e meme.jpg 

DECIMAL       HEXADECIMAL     DESCRIPTION
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
0             0x0             JPEG image data, JFIF standard 1.01
30            0x1E            TIFF image data, big-endian, offset of first image directory: 8
74407         0x122A7         RAR archive data, version 5.x
74478         0x122EE         PNG image, 147 x 37, 8-bit/color RGBA, non-interlaced
74629         0x12385         Zlib compressed data, default compression
```

First image
```
hackerchat.png
```

Get decompress software for zlib:
```
mkdir offzip
cd offzip
wget http://aluigi.org/mytoolz/offzip.zip
unzip offzip.zip
make
```

```
./offline/offzip -a 12385.zlib . 0  

Offzip 0.4.1
by Luigi Auriemma
e-mail: aluigi@autistici.org
web:    aluigi.org

- open input file:    12385.zlib
- enter in directory: .
- zip data to check:  32 bytes
- zip windowBits:     15
- seek offset:        0x00000000  (0)

+------------+-----+----------------------------+----------------------+
| hex_offset | ... | zip -> unzip size / offset | spaces before | info |
+------------+-----+----------------------------+----------------------+
  0x00000000 ... 5373 -> 21793 / 0x000014fd _ 0 8:7:28:0:1:c579f5ca


- 1 valid compressed streams found
- 0x000014fd -> 0x00005521 bytes covering the 97% of the file                                                       
```

It seems the solution is simpler, just
```
strings meme.jpg
```

Reveal the flag.

## Flag

```
"AHH_YOU_FOUND_ME!"
```
